questions.question: What does ISO actually control in a digital camera?
options: The physical sensitivity of the sensor
The amount of light the lens transmits
The amplification of the sensor's signal after capture
The color temperature of the image
questions.reviewHint: ISO = signal gain, not lens light or white balance.

questions.question: As ISO increases (all else equal), which artifact increases most?
questions.reviewHint: Higher ISO → more visible noise, especially in shadows.

questions.question: Best everyday practice with ISO is to…
options: Always shoot base ISO, even if motion blurs
Use the lowest ISO that still gives the shutter/aperture you need
Use maximum ISO and denoise later
questions.reviewHint: Balance clean image vs. needed shutter/aperture.

questions.question: Which is most likely a camera's base/native ISO?
questions.reviewHint: Many cameras have base ISO ≈ 100 (some ≈ 64 or 200).

questions.question: Indoors at 1/30s, f/2.8, ISO 100, your subject is blurry from motion. Quickest fix (same mode) is to…
questions.reviewHint: Higher ISO lets you use a faster shutter to freeze motion.

questions.question: In Aperture Priority with Auto ISO and a minimum shutter set, as light drops (and max ISO isn't reached) the camera will…
questions.reviewHint: Auto ISO tries to hold your min shutter by increasing ISO.

questions.question: Does ISO change depth of field or perspective?
options: Yes, higher ISO gives shallower depth of field
No—ISO doesn't change DoF or perspective
Yes, lower ISO increases background blur
questions.reviewHint: ISO only affects signal gain/brightness, not optics.

questions.question: Your photo at ISO 6400 looks noisy. Next time, what helps reduce noise most?
options: Use a lower ISO with a longer shutter (tripod/brace)
Increase ISO further and denoise later
questions.reviewHint: Lower ISO generally = cleaner file (if you can stabilize).

questions.question: With manual flash power fixed, increasing ISO from 200 → 400 will…
options: Brighten ambient but not flash exposure
Brighten both ambient and flash-lit areas by one stop
questions.reviewHint: ISO boosts all recorded light, including flash.

questions.question: Which statement about Auto ISO is accurate?
options: It adjusts ISO (within limits) to maintain exposure/min shutter
It turns off the light meter
questions.reviewHint: Auto ISO raises/lowers ISO automatically within your limits.

questions.question: Start at 1/60s, f/4, ISO 100. You change to ISO 400 (+2 stops). To keep the same exposure, which shutter?
questions.reviewHint: +2 stops ISO → make shutter 2 stops faster (1/60 → 1/125 → 1/250).
